AttackerCapabilities: Knowledge of bypassing checks on input parameters

Steps.Description: Craft a payload to bypass the strict check on the 'warmup' GET parameter

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to bypass the strict check on the 'warmup' GET parameter in order to execute arbitrary code.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a payload using bitwise XOR operation to create a non-alphanumeric representation of the '_GET' string and assign it to a variable with a non-alphanumeric name.
StepDetails.Result: The payload successfully bypasses the strict check on the 'warmup' GET parameter.

Steps.Description: Specify the execution of the content of a GET parameter using the crafted payload

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to execute the content of a GET parameter using the non-alphanumeric representation of the '_GET' string.
StepDetails.Action: Use the non-alphanumeric representation of the '_GET' string to invoke the specified GET parameter.
StepDetails.Result: The content of the specified GET parameter is executed.

Steps.Description: Compose the complete payload to read the 'flag.php' file

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to read the 'flag.php' file by executing the 'file_get_contents' function.
StepDetails.Action: Compose a payload that includes the execution of 'file_get_contents' on the 'flag.php' file.
StepDetails.Result: The 'flag.php' file is read and its contents are obtained.
